Title: MemTreeMap
Description: MemTreeMap is a tool that shows the memory usage of the system RAM graphically in a treemap. The Treemap control from the visualisation components of the microsoft research is used.
HomeWiki:
MemTreeMap shows a graphical overview of the memory usage of your computer

Process Explorer from sysinternals is always open on my system. Often I wished to see how all the memory is spent without checking numbers in Process Explorer. MemTreeMap uses the Visualisation Components from Microsoft Research to show the memory usage in a practical way.
There are a bunch of tools to chek the harddisk usage (WinDirStat, Sequoia, ...), but only one (which name i forgot) for the RAM usage, and that one isn't free anymore.
